Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <ver_User> at the moment I think it's balanced out quite a lot so buying may well be the same as mining

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <GlorymanRTS> we are talking about it, but changing price and difficulty in measuring the hash to coins makes it hard to conclude

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <ver_User> I see, I guess opportunity cost is one factor

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <ver_User> just buy and stake, easier decision and less management 😉

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <ver_User> use auto shield script from englal

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <GlorymanRTS> the hard part is deciding what harware to buy, it the price is highish and stable then 1080 ti is good. If the price is dropping or we get less coins then its better to buy amd.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <GlorymanRTS> and mine a different coin

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <ver_User> yeah at this stage I would just wonder what would you get if you just buy at market and stake with the same value you would have put into hardware/electricity, and then some value on the time and mental power you would have spent on the mining setup/maintenance. That's just me though

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <ver_User> could go 5050 - match your staking percentage with a an equivalent mining setup, hope for stable returns/hashrate

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Sophal> It's good to have GPUs because you can always switch coins where it's profitable.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Sophal> Staking on coins is risky... because coins can go down.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <GlorymanRTS> Yeah i agree

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Sophal> I see coins dipped 1000 percent sometime.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <GlorymanRTS> And if a coin goes up you can always mine the coin and make a big profit.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <GlorymanRTS> But obviously it's not like hitting the lottery

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Sophal> Or just sell GPUs when you don't need them anymore.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Sophal> I bought AMD Vega 64 when it was first came out.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Sophal> It was sold for $375 on Egghead.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Sophal> I bought two.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Sophal> Now, I see people still selling it for $500 on Craigslist.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Crupti> Everyone is dumping their GPUs here, getting cheaper by the day.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Crupti> people are selling 970 GTXs for $100

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Sophal> Old and obsolete GPUs maybe.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Sophal> Vega and 1080 TI still expensive.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Sophal> If I sell my Vega now I still make $100 in profit.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Crupti> I have two GTX 970s I bought for $120 and $100 USD, they mine 350 MH/s each at only 290 watts, dirt cheap and getting cheaper by the day because everyone is getting out of the GPU mining over here 😉

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Sophal> You're talking about 2-3 years old GPUs hahah.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Crupti> @Sophal Why are you laughing at me?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Crupti> It is all about ROI, not power

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Sophal> Vega 64 and 1080 TI  about 1+ years old.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Sophal> I learned it's good to sell your GPUs after a year or so.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Crupti> Best ROI at the moment is the GTX 970, don't understand why that is so funny.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Sophal> Then invest on newest ones.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Sophal> I used to do that... I bought 480s when people buying 580s.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Sophal> Then I bought 580s and and sold 480s... but when Vega 64 came out selling my old 480s was hard.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Sophal> Now, I set one year for old GPUs.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Sophal> Get rid of it as fast as new ones come out.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Crupti> @Sophal The newest are not as profitable, you can buy 3x GTX 970 for $300 now, which will mine at the same MH/s as a single GTX 1080 TI which costs $650 used, that's 2x the price for the same performance...

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Sophal> Like I said sold your old ones for the same price or little higher than you bought it is not too bad.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Crupti> @Sophal What are you talking about "the same price or a little higher" - you pay less than half for the same performance...

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Sophal> I bought Vega 64 for $375, it's sold online for $500 right now.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Sophal> It had good run for Ethereum and I made profit from it... still can sell higher than I bought them.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Sophal> Right now people with 1080 TI can still sell theirs for great prices... and get XTI cards.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Cruz99> @Crupti I had a 970 build, maybe 9 months ago... While everyone was in a panic to ROI, I already had, because I spent $80-$100, for 23-25/mh

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Crupti> @Cruz99 Yeah. Problem with newer GPU cards is that you get the high performance but the ROI is worse than the low end cards.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Crupti> For example, the 1050 is selling used for the same price as the 970 at 100 MH/s less when mining Verus. 1060 is 2x the price of the 970 but only has 1.5x the mining performance.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Crupti> So currently, the 970 has the best ROI for Verus mining and the prices keep dropping - that's at least how I see it.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Crupti> https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1RrSYJDV0Mjj3X-myMC3aQDGkcipivxHsD7ZxJ3r5f_A/edit#gid=838026385

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Cruz99> @Crupti Anything this detailed--should be moved to the appropriate room .. I'm not trying to be rude or anything.. 😬

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Cruz99> We have GPU hashrate or CPU hashrate, or Mining

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <ok88> @Crupti You are absolutely right if performance per dollar spent would be the single KPI for the mining facility. With business as a whole mindset, reselling value, warranty and performance per wat are important as well and I believe Pascal is way to go and Touring if only prices will drop or next releases will become available.

Content: I like Verus project a lot. We are considering VerusHash algorithm for Marmara Chain. We want Marmara Coin to be mineable by normal CPUs.
